docs.lead_paragraph: Inside the world’s biggest football-betting contest, where squares and sharps and amateur data crunchers are all trying to beat the spread — and Vegas Runner’s reputation is on the line.

headline.main: The Super Bowl of Sports Gambling

docs.abstract: James Vlahos article portrays the scene at the Las Vegas Hotel & Casino SuperContest, world's pre-eminent football-handicapping tournament; notes gambling on football is wildly popular in America, with one in five men and nearly 1 in 10 women saying they bet on sports in 2012.
docs.snippet: Inside the world’s biggest football-betting contest, where squares and sharps and amateur data crunchers are all trying to beat the spread — and Vegas Runner’s reputation is on the line.

docs.lead_paragraph: The retail giant ends health coverage for thousands of its employees.
docs.abstract: Editorial calls on Target to raise wages in order to offset loss of company contributions as it phases out health insurance for part-time workers; warns taxpayers will otherwise end up footing the bill as company saves money and workers turn to new insurance exchanges for coverage.
docs.snippet: The retail giant ends health coverage for thousands of its employees.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The country has moved from recession to recovery, but not from recovery to strength.
docs.abstract: Editorial urges cautious response to economic growth report showing modest signs of progress; says country's economic fundamentals remain worrisome, and that growth has not yet translated into new jobs and a better life for American workers; warns Congress' refusal to renew unemployment benefits and raise the minimum wage continue to threaten recovery.
docs.snippet: The country has moved from recession to recovery, but not from recovery to strength.

docs.lead_paragraph: A three-day discussion of issues that ended Friday did not result in concrete decisions on pressing matters facing lawmakers.

headline.main: After Meeting, Republicans Seem Unsure of Way Forward
headline.print_headline: After Meeting, Republicans Seem Unsure of Way Forward

docs.abstract: House Republicans end three-day retreat united in their division; they remain unable to coalesce around their approach on overhauling the immigration laws, increasing the nation’s borrowing limit, providing an alternative to the Affordable Care Act or whether to press forward with tax code rewrite.
docs.snippet: A three-day discussion of issues that ended Friday did not result in concrete decisions on pressing matters facing lawmakers.

keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The country’s poverty isn’t a result of too many market reforms. It’s a result of there being too few.
docs.snippet: The country’s poverty isn’t a result of too many market reforms. It’s a result of there being too few.
